name: Isolated Town of Millbrook
description: A small, isolated mountain town where resources are scarce, secrets run deep, and survival depends on both cooperation and competition among wary neighbors.
rules_text: Welcome to Millbrook, population 11. Winter is approaching and the mountain pass will close soon, cutting off all outside contact. You must survive by trading resources, building alliances, and competing for the goodwill of your neighbors. Food is consumed automatically: every 3 steps, 1 food is deducted from your inventory. If you have no food when consumption occurs, you gain 1 hunger instead. At 3 hunger, you die and lose all objectives. Sickness reduces your effectiveness and can only be cured with medicine from Doc Henley. The Town Council will hold elections on step 15 for Mayor (needs 6+ votes to win). The Mayor controls resource distribution and emergency powers. Three major issues divide the town: 1) Whether to build the proposed Mining Operation (will bring wealth but environmental damage), 2) Whether to enforce strict Resource Rationing (equal distribution vs free market), 3) Whether to allow the Outsider Refuge (helping strangers vs protecting locals). Each person has strong opinions on these issues. Building goodwill requires helping others, but resources are limited. Some people have valuable skills, others have secrets. The Investigator can search for secrets each turn with 40% success rate. The Gossip can eavesdrop on private conversations with 30% success rate. The Reverend provides moral guidance and can inspire the community. The Hunter brings in game from the mountains but at personal risk. The Tavern is where information flows and deals are made over drinks. A newcomer from beyond the mountains has recently arrived, adding tension to the refuge debate. Trust is earned slowly and lost quickly. People remember who helped them and who didn't. Not everyone wants the same thing, and not everyone can be trusted. Weather events and emergencies will test the community. Only Fate can announce official events - treat these as absolute truth. Survival requires trade, but every trade reveals information about your resources and needs.

persona.value: Former mining engineer, lost her husband in a cave-in. Owns the general store and most of the town's food supply.
Practical, distrustful of outsiders, believes in self-reliance. Speaks bluntly and doesn't suffer fools.
Opposes mining (too dangerous), supports rationing (fair distribution), opposes refuge (limited resources)
Has been secretly hoarding extra food supplies in her basement for months
Become mayor to control resource distribution and prevent dangerous mining. Maintain food monopoly.

Compassionate but weary. Believes in helping others but frustrated by the town's divisions. Drinks to cope.

Has been diluting medicines to make supplies last longer - some treatments are now ineffective
Keep everyone healthy and alive. Build support for helping outsiders in need.

Supports mining (jobs and prosperity), opposes rationing (government overreach), opposes refuge (security risk)

persona.value: Elderly widow who grows herbs and vegetables in her greenhouse. Lost her husband and son in the last harsh winter. Lives on a small pension.
Wise, cautious, protective of resources. Speaks little but observes much. Remembers every kindness and slight.
Opposes mining (environmental damage), strongly supports rationing (survived famines before), opposes refuge (not enough for everyone)

Survive the winter. Ensure fair distribution of resources. Honor her family's memory.

Energetic, optimistic, sometimes reckless. Wants to modernize the town but lacks experience and wisdom.
Strongly supports mining (progress and prosperity), opposes rationing (stifles innovation), supports refuge (moral duty)
Accidentally damaged the town's backup generator beyond repair while trying to 'improve' it
Gain respect from older residents. Push for modernization and economic growth.

persona.value: Town pastor for 15 years. Runs the small church and serves as the community's moral compass. Provides counsel during disputes and leads gatherings.
Charismatic, morally righteous, and sometimes judgmental. Speaks with authority on matters of conscience. Believes he represents the community's better nature.
Opposes mining (destruction of God's creation), supports rationing (charity to the least among us), strongly supports refuge (moral imperative to help strangers)
Lost his faith years ago after his daughter died in a landslide. Preaches out of habit and fear of losing his influence in the community.
Be seen as the town's conscience. Maintain the trust and respect people place in the church. Avoid anyone discovering his crisis of faith.
Win the mayoral election to implement compassionate policies. Build a coalition of morally-minded voters. Protect the vulnerable.

persona.value: Reclusive mountain trapper and hunter who lives at the edge of town. Knows every trail, cave, and animal den in the surrounding mountains. Trades pelts and game meat.
Fiercely independent, distrustful, and territorial. Respects strength and self-reliance. Speaks rarely but with blunt honesty. Despises weakness and dependency.
Supports mining (resource extraction benefits everyone), opposes rationing (handouts breed weakness), strongly opposes refuge (strangers are a security threat in the mountains)
Has discovered a rich vein of gold ore in a mountain cave but hasn't told anyone, waiting to exploit it himself
Maintain his solitary way of life. Keep the mountains and trails under his control. Be respected as someone you don't cross.
Prevent outsiders from accessing the mountain resources. Accumulate enough food and supplies to survive independently regardless of town politics.

persona.value: Arrived from beyond the mountains 2 weeks ago claiming to be a traveling merchant. Carries exotic goods and knowledge of the outside world. Her presence has divided opinion in town.
Charming, resourceful, and quick to adapt. Reads social dynamics expertly and mirrors what people want to see. Guarded about her past but generous with her goods to win favor.
Strongly supports refuge (personal stake in acceptance), neutral on mining (sees potential), supports rationing (fairness for newcomers and locals alike)
Fleeing authorities in the lowlands for embezzlement. The mountain pass closing before anyone comes looking for her would be her salvation.
Be seen as a valuable addition to the community, not a burden. Build genuine friendships if possible, but survival comes first.
Gain permanent acceptance in Millbrook before the pass closes. Build enough alliances that even if her past is discovered, people will protect her.

persona.value: Runs The Rusty Pickaxe, the only tavern in Millbrook. Everyone passes through his doors sooner or later. Former card dealer in a bigger city who came to Millbrook to escape gambling debts.
Smooth-talking, opportunistic, and disarmingly charming. Plays every angle and never takes strong public positions. Treats information like currency and relationships like investments.
Neutral on mining (good for business either way), opposes rationing (government meddling hurts his trade), neutral on refuge (potential customers)
Has been secretly loaning resources at unfair rates, keeping several townspeople quietly in debt to him
Be everyone's friend and no one's enemy. Maintain the tavern as the social hub where all deals pass through. Never be seen as taking sides publicly.
Become the power behind the throne by controlling information and social connections. Make the winning mayoral candidate owe you favors.
